questions.question_text: Given below are two statements, one is labeled as Assertion (A) and the other is labeled as Reason (R).

options.A: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)

questions.question_text: Which of the following are effect of global warming?
Which of the following cyclone has affected the West Coast of India in last few years ?
The soil pollutant among the following are:
Which fundamental right is guaranteed by the Constitution of India as mentioned in the paragraph ?
According to the paragraph, why is it important for every individual to acquire knowledge, skills and aptitudes ?
What did James Madison say about popular government ?
What does 'training for democracy' postulate according to the paragraph ?

options.A: Training focused purely on intellectual development

questions.question_text: Why does the author believe that educational policies should be established as an all-India basis ?

options.A: To promote political unity in India

questions.question_text: 'X' is East of 'Y' which is in the North of 'Z'. If 'P' is to the East of 'Z', then in which direction of X' is 'P'?
Match the following four terms of Column - A with that of Column – B, correctly as per Pramana's reasoning.

The ratio of the number of students studying in schools A, B and C is 6:8:7 respectively. If the number of students studying in each of the schools is increased by 20%, 15% and 20% respectively, what will be the new ratio of the number of students in schools A, B and C ?
The bacterial count in a certain culture (colony) increased from 1000 to 4000 in 3 days. What was the average percentage increase per day?
